intro: Vera-duthiea amboensis, commonly known as the Ambo endemic, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing adaptations to its arid environment. Its leaves are usually narrow and leathery, helping to reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
